list_definition.definition: to sleep longer than one intended

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He overslept and missed the train.

list_ex_of_english: There are no benefits to oversleeping and it can result in sleep inertia, which is the feeling of drowsiness for a period of time after waking.
He used to want from people protect themselves overusing the things that neither recommended nor forbidden by religious law like that overeating and oversleeping.
In days gone by if they overslept a quarter of an hour they might catch the next bus, but that cannot happen to-day.
It is like the boy who is late for school, and who says that he has overslept himself.
The following morning they oversleep and are late for their wedding.
It follows then that oversleep and overstay are instances of scalebased excess rather than container-based excess.
They have to go to work, but they often oversleep, and when they have to go to distant places they arrive very often without having had their breakfast.
Other examples of oversleep and overstay below can be also analyzed along this line.
